Walk of Fame

These people taught me so much! I want to say thank you each of them and share their Twitter profiles.

  • Jen Simmons She is simply amazing! I learned css grid and a lot css properties from her videos.
  • Sara Soueidan Goddess of semantic html, css and a11y. Just read her blog posts. You will not regret.
  • Adem İlter Every Turkish developer / designer knows him. If you want to sharpen your skills check his YouTube channel.
  • Andy Bell You can learn a lot of things even while inspect his website. Btw check out his modern css reset on Github.
  • Mike Dane I discovered him while I learn Hugo. His teaching skills are amazing.
  • Wes Bos Ready to learn css or javascript? Start with his courses. I watched his CSS Grid course.
  • Rachel Andrew Are you a front-end developer? Just follow her.
  • Michelle Barker She has a website for real life css tips and tricks. You might want to read her all blog posts.
  • Alaa Alnuaimi I'm following him for his creative agency.
  • Samantha Ming She is sharing js, html and css tidbits on her website. Spicy!
  • Gökhan Kandemir I recommend his courses (in Turkish) who wants to start from zero.
  • Pieter Levels Creator of Nomad List. Just follow him. You will not regret.
  • Pete R. He is describing himself as a travel blogger. His BucketListly project inspired me a lot!
  • Stephanie Eckles She runs a website for old css problems with modern solutions. I love her approach to the problems!
